column4: have you tried installing libx11-dev ? i think djm62's command will install needed dependencies
checkin'
libx11-dev is not installed.
use synaptic or apt-get to install it
a colleague of mine has, with warty
k. but just to understand: do you mean that configure couldn't find the "includes" and "librairies" because there not installed?
oh, sorry, i meant dual processor
aladdin: yeah. usually you need to install a "-dev" package to get include files
... cause I thought it was because that particular installer is looking for XFree86's by default.
well, try installing libx11-dev and see what happens
sudo apt-get install libx11-dev
k
the thrill of finding dependencies for compiling wears thin before long ;)
it's installed. I'll retry configure... bbl
good luck
looks like it's a kde app - you'll probably need other packages
can't you just install gwenview from apt?
ah
well, the comment re other -dev packages stands
actually I am running under K (Kubuntu) and all packages work well includinf gwenview. This is a external addon to it, not Ubuntu prepared, but debian compatible.
ok, but it's quite likely you'll needed kde-type -dev packages. ./configure should give you a clue
... k now configure goes further (so our thing worked). I get a new error: can't find zlib. Gues I try to install it from synaptic too....
get djm62 to help you with that "apt-get build-dep" thing
